publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-1755 Mr Kenneth Gibson: War Crime of Mass Rape—That the Parliament acknowledges the recent landmark ruling from the Yugoslav War Crimes trial in the Hague that recognises mass rape as a war crime; notes that for the first time such acts and sexual enslavement in times of war will be regarded in international law as crimes against humanity, second in gravity only to genocide, and believes that speaking about the reality of rape as a war crime and challenging its existence is the only way towards ending it. Supported by: Linda Fabiani*
S1M-1755 War Crime of Mass Rape (lodged on 14 March 2001) Alex Neil*, Mr Gil Paterson*, Mr Adam Ingram*, Mr Lloyd Quinan*, Dorothy-Grace Elder*

S1M-1755 Mr Kenneth Gibson: War Crime of Mass Rape—That the Parliament acknowledges the recent landmark ruling from the Yugoslav War Crimes trial in the Hague that recognises mass rape as a war crime; notes that for the first time such acts and sexual enslavement in times of war will be regarded in international law as crimes against humanity, second in gravity only to genocide, and believes that speaking about the reality of rape as a war crime and challenging its existence is the only way towards ending it. Supported by: Linda Fabiani, Alex Neil, Mr Gil Paterson, Mr Adam Ingram, Mr Lloyd Quinan, Dorothy-Grace Elder
S1M-1755 War Crime of Mass Rape (lodged on 14 March 2001) Michael Russell*, Tommy Sheridan*, Mrs Margaret Ewing*, Andrew Wilson*
S1M-1755 War Crime of Mass Rape (lodged on 14 March 2001) Mrs Lyndsay McIntosh*
